fissionmunk package

Submodules

fissionmunk.ControlRod module

class fissionmunk.ControlRod.ControlRod(length, width, position, movement_range, tag='E', material=MaterialType.BORON_CARBIDE)[source]

Bases: object

The ControlRod class is used to create the control rod in the reactor. It is used to control the fission reaction in the reactor as it absorbs the neutron.

create_control_rod()[source]

The method is used to create the control rod. This is not a public method.

Returns:
control_rod_body: pymunk.Body

The body of the control rod.

control_rod_shape: pymunk.Poly

The shape of the control rod.

get_body()[source]

The method is used to get the body of the control rod.

Returns:
body: pymunk.Body

The body of the control

get_length()[source]

The method is used to get the length of the control rod.

Returns:
length: int

The length of the control

get_position()[source]

The method is used to get the position of the control rod.

Returns:
position: tuple

The position of the control rod.

get_reach_bottom()[source]

The method is used to check if the control rod has reached the bottom of the reactor space. (movement range)

Returns:
reach_bottom: bool

True if the control rod has reached the bottom of the reactor space. Otherwise, False.

get_reach_top()[source]

The method is used to check if the control rod has reached the top of the reactor space. (movement range)

Returns:
reach_top: bool

True if the control rod has reached the top of the reactor space. Otherwise, False.

get_shape()[source]

The method is used to get the shape of the control rod.

Returns:
shape: pymunk.Poly

The shape of the control rod.

get_tag()[source]

The method is used to get the tag of the control rod.

Returns:
tag: str

The tag of the control rod.

get_width()[source]

The method is used to get the width of the control rod.

Returns:
width: int

The width of the control

move_control_rod(amount)[source]

The method is used to move the control rod.

Args:
amount: int

The amount by which the control rod is moved

Returns:

None

set_position(position)[source]

The method is used to set the position of the control rod.

Args:
position: tuple

The position of the control rod.

Returns:

None

set_tag(tag)[source]

The method is used to set the tag of the control rod.

Args:
tag: str

The tag of the control rod.

Returns:

None

fissionmunk.Core module

class fissionmunk.Core.Core(length, width, neutron_speed=(40, 0), thermal_factor=50, cold_factor=10, fast_factor=100)[source]

Bases: object

The class is used to create a core object. Core is the main object of the simulation. It contains all the objects that are used in the simulation.

add_control_rod_to_core(control_rod)[source]

The method is used to add the control rod to the core.

Args:
control_rod: ControlRod

The control rod object to be added to the core.

Returns:

None

fissionmunk.Material module

class fissionmunk.Material.MaterialType(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enum class for the different types of materials that can be used in the simulation.

BORON = 'boron'
BORON_CARBIDE = 'boron carbide'
FISSILE = 'fissile'
GRAPHITE = 'graphite'
NON_FISSILE = 'non-fissile'
WATER = 'water'
XENON = 'xenon'

fissionmunk.Moderator module

class fissionmunk.Moderator.Moderator(length, width, position, material=MaterialType.WATER)[source]

Bases: object

A class to represent a moderator in a nuclear reactor. Moderators are used to slow down neutrons to speeds that are more likely to cause fission.

create_moderator()[source]

Creates a moderator body and shape.

Returns:

rect_body (pymunk.Body): body of the moderator. rect_shape (pymunk.Poly): shape of the moderator.

get_body()[source]

Returns the body of the moderator.

Returns:
body (pymunk.Body):

The body of the moderator.

get_length()[source]

Returns the length of the moderator.

Returns:
length (int):

The length of the moderator.

get_material()[source]

Returns the material of the moderator.

Returns:
material (MaterialType):

The material of the moderator.

get_position()[source]

Returns the position of the moderator.

Returns:
position (tuple):

The position of the moderator.

get_shape()[source]

Returns the shape of the moderator.

Returns:
shape (pymunk.Poly):

The shape of the moderator.

get_width()[source]

Returns the width of the moderator.

Returns:
width (int):

The width of the moderator.

Args:
position (tuple):

The position of the moderator.

fissionmunk.Water module

class fissionmunk.Water.Water(length, width, position, coolant=True, hard_limit=30, temperature_threshold=100, material=MaterialType.WATER)[source]

Bases: object

The Water class is used to create a water body in the simulation. Water absorbs neutrons and cools down the reactor. It is used as a coolant in the reactor.

body_to_water = {}
change_collision_type(collision_type=11)[source]

Args:

None

fissionmunk.helper module

class fissionmunk.helper.EventDispatcher[source]

Bases: object

A simple event dispatcher class that allows objects to listen for events and dispatch them.

add_listener(event_name, listener)[source]

Add a listener for a specific event.

Args:
event_name: str

The name of the event.

listener: function

The listener function to be called when the event is dispatched.

Returns:

None

dispatch(event_name, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Dispatch an event to all listeners.

Args:
event_name: str

The name of the event.

*args: list

The arguments to be passed to the listeners.

**kwargs: dict

The keyword arguments to be passed to the listeners.

Returns:

None

remove_listener(event_name, listener)[source]

Remove a listener for a specific event.

Args:
event_name: str

The name of the event.

listener: function

The listener function to be removed.

Returns:

None

fissionmunk.helper.get_probability()[source]

The function is used to generate a random number between 0 and 1.

Returns:
random_number: float

The random number between 0 and 1.

fissionmunk.mechanics module

class fissionmunk.mechanics.Mechanics(core=None)[source]

Bases: object

Mechanics class for the simulation This class is responsible for handling the physics of the simulation

generate_random_neutron(limit)[source]

Method to generate a random neutron in the core

Args:

limit: Limit for the probability of neutron occurence

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise

neutron_boundary_collision(arbiter, space, data)[source]

Method to handle neutron-boundary collision

Args:

arbiter: Arbiter object space: Space object data: Data object

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise

neutron_control_rod_collision(arbiter, space, data)[source]

Method to handle neutron-control rod collision

Args:

arbiter: Arbiter object space: Space object data: Data object

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise

neutron_fuel_element_collision(arbiter, space, data)[source]

Method to handle neutron-fuel element collision

Args:

arbiter: Arbiter object space: Space object data: Data object

Returns:

True if successful, False otherwise

neutron_moderator_collision(arbiter, space, data)[source]

class fissionmunk.ControlRod(length, width, position, movement_range, tag='E', material=MaterialType.BORON_CARBIDE)[source]

Bases: object

The ControlRod class is used to create the control rod in the reactor. It is used to control the fission reaction in the reactor as it absorbs the neutron.

class fissionmunk.Core(length, width, neutron_speed=(40, 0), thermal_factor=50, cold_factor=10, fast_factor=100)[source]

Bases: object

The class is used to create a core object. Core is the main object of the simulation. It contains all the objects that are used in the simulation.

class fissionmunk.EventDispatcher[source]

Bases: object

A simple event dispatcher class that allows objects to listen for events and dispatch them.

add_listener(event_name, listener)[source]

Add a listener for a specific event.

Args:
event_name: str

The name of the event.

listener: function

The listener function to be called when the event is dispatched.

Returns:

None

dispatch(event_name, *args, **kwargs)[source]

Dispatch an event to all listeners.

Args:
event_name: str

The name of the event.

*args: list

The arguments to be passed to the listeners.

**kwargs: dict

The keyword arguments to be passed to the listeners.

Returns:

None

remove_listener(event_name, listener)[source]

Remove a listener for a specific event.

Args:
event_name: str

The name of the event.

listener: function

The listener function to be removed.

Returns:

None

class fissionmunk.Moderator(length, width, position, material=MaterialType.WATER)[source]

Bases: object

A class to represent a moderator in a nuclear reactor. Moderators are used to slow down neutrons to speeds that are more likely to cause fission.

Returns:

rect_body (pymunk.Body): body of the moderator. rect_shape (pymunk.Poly): shape of the moderator.

class fissionmunk.Water(length, width, position, coolant=True, hard_limit=30, temperature_threshold=100, material=MaterialType.WATER)[source]

Bases: object

The Water class is used to create a water body in the simulation. Water absorbs neutrons and cools down the reactor. It is used as a coolant in the reactor.
